creator: markjdb@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 27386
A patch for the problem described above

There are a few places where websh calls Tcl_GetIndexFromObj and passes in a string table that doesn't have a null-terminator. In our case, if interpcfg is called with a parameter that doesn't exactly match one of the table entries (it was numreq vs. numrequests for us), tcl may crash depending on what comes after the table in memory.

I've attached a patch which fixes the two cases of this that I've found; there could well be others.

creator: ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text:
Thanks Mark for the report and the patch. Looks good, I applied and already committed it.
I (very quickly) checked all other string tables, all of them are NULL terminated. -> These should be the only ones (at least for that particular problem ;-)

-> Your fix is committed to HEAD
